title: How to Use Veet Hair Removal Cream & Wax Strips on Your Bikini Area

steps.title: Trim your pubic hair
steps.content: Trim your pubic hair to ¼ in (0.6 cm) long, then wash your bikini area. Depilatory, or hair removal, creams work best on short hair. Just sit in a comfortable position and hold a hand mirror to see your pubic hair. Then, cut your pubic hair ¼ to ½ in (0.6-1.3 cm) long with a clean pair of nail or mustache scissors. Wash your bikini area with soap and water and then pat it dry. [1] X Research source Sit on paper towels or a bath towel to catch the excess hair as you cut. Patch test a small area of skin with Veet 24 hours before you use it. If your skin gets irritated or you develop an allergic reaction, do not use Veet. Exfoliate your bikini area with a sugar scrub or exfoliating glove 24 hours before you use the cream. Exfoliating removes dead skin cells and reduces your risk of ingrown hairs. [2] X Expert Source Melissa Jannes Licensed Esthetician Expert Interview. 30 August 2019.

steps.title: Apply a thick, even layer of Veet cream over your pubic hair.
steps.content: Apply a thick, even layer of Veet cream over your pubic hair. Whether you’re cleaning up your bikini line or going entirely bare, squeeze the Veet onto the tip of the applicator that came with the cream. Then, smooth it over all of the pubic hair you want to remove. If your cream didn’t come with an applicator, just slather on the cream with your fingers, making sure not to rub it in. [4] X Research source Read your product’s label to verify that it’s safe to use on your bikini area. Veet has different types of depilatory creams for different parts of your body. [5] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Do not place the cream on your genitals. This can cause an adverse reaction as this area is extremely sensitive. [6] X Research source If you have sensitive skin, use Veet Cream for Sensitive Skin . This cream is only recommended for use on your bikini line. Wash your hands when you’re done applying the cream.

steps.title: Wipe away a small area of cream after 2 minutes.
steps.content: Wipe away a small area of cream after 2 minutes. Check to see if your hair comes off easily after leaving the cream on for 2 minutes. Just take a damp washcloth to wipe away a small spot of cream. If your hair comes off with the Veet, wipe off the rest of the cream. If your hair still isn’t budging, let the cream sit for 1 more minute, then check it again. [7] X Research source Check the cream every 1 minute until you reach the maximum amount of time that you can leave it on your skin according to the label directions.

steps.title: Leave the Veet cream on your bikini area for up to 6 minutes.
steps.content: Leave the Veet cream on your bikini area for up to 6 minutes. The amount of time that it takes the cream to remove your hair varies. Simply set a timer to make sure that you don’t leave the cream on for longer than 6 minutes, even if your hair isn’t coming off. If you leave the cream on longer than instructed, it can burn or irritate your skin. [8] X Research source Check the label on your product to verify how long to leave it on your skin.

steps.title: Use a washcloth to wipe the cream and hair off your skin.
steps.content: Use a washcloth to wipe the cream and hair off your skin. Place a dry washcloth over your palm. Then, slowly wipe the cream off your body, moving in an upward direction toward your waist. Just make several swipes to remove all of the Veet and your pubic hair. [9] X Research source Alternatively, use the applicator that came with your product to remove the cream. Just rinse it off first and then swipe off the cream. If you’re removing the cream in the shower, rinse off the washcloth between swipes. If you trimmed your pubic hair, this shouldn’t clog up your drain. If you don’t want to rinse off your washcloth in the shower or sink, get a new washcloth when the first gets covered with Veet and hair.

steps.title: Rinse your bikini area with warm water and pat it dry.
steps.content: Rinse your bikini area with warm water and pat it dry. To remove all of the Veet residue from your skin, splash warm water over the entire area where you applied the cream. Just use your hands or a clean washcloth to gently wipe down your skin. Then, grab a soft towel and pat your bikini area dry. [10] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Don’t scrub your skin right after you use Veet as it can cause irritation. Apply a gentle, fragrance-free moisturizer to your dry skin to help calm down any irritation.

steps.title: Use tweezers to remove any remaining stray hairs.
steps.content: Use tweezers to remove any remaining stray hairs. After removing the cream and cleaning your bikini area, you might see a few stray hairs that were left behind. Just grab a pair of tweezers and pluck the hairs out to get your bikini area totally smooth. [11] X Research source Wash your tweezers after you use them on your bikini area. If you have a lot of stray hairs, gently shave off the remaining hairs. Put on cotton underwear and loose bottoms after you use the hair removal cream to prevent ingrown hairs from forming. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Cut your hair so it’s ½ in (1.3 cm) long, then wash your bikini area.
steps.content: Cut your hair so it’s ½ in (1.3 cm) long, then wash your bikini area. To help the wax adhere to your skin and remove your pubic hair, trim it to about ¼ to ½ in (0.6-1.3 cm) long. [13] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Just use nail or mustache scissors to cut and a hand mirror to help you see. Then, wash your bikini area with soap and warm water and dry it off with a towel. [14] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Wax strips can’t grasp hair that’s shorter than ¼ in (0.6 cm) long. Patch test and exfoliate your skin 24 hours before using Veet wax strips.

steps.title: Lay out a towel and sit on it with your legs spread open.
steps.content: Lay out a towel and sit on it with your legs spread open. To prevent sticky wax and pieces of hair from dirtying your floor, spread out a clean bath or beach towel that you don’t mind getting dirty. Then, sit in the center of the towel and spread your legs open so you can see your entire bikini area. [15] X Research source Use a hand mirror to help you see your bikini area more easily. Adjust your position while you work to ensure you stay comfortable and can see the area you’re waxing.

steps.title: Rub a Veet wax strip between your hands to warm it up.
steps.content: Rub a Veet wax strip between your hands to warm it up. Place a wax strip between your palms and rub your hands together for 5 to 10 seconds to warm up the wax. This activates the wax and makes the strip easier to pull apart. [16] X Research source Read the label on your wax strips to ensure they’re safe to use on your bikini area. If you have sensitive skin, use Veet Wax Strips for Sensitive Skin . If the wax still feels cold, rub it a little longer until it feels warm. When the wax is ready, it should feel room temperature or slightly warm, not hot.

steps.title: Peel a strip apart and set the 2 strips on the towel wax-side up.
steps.content: Peel a strip apart and set the 2 strips on the towel wax-side up. Each packaged strip contains 2 strips of wax that are stuck together. To wax your bikini area, you apply and remove 1 strip at a time. Just grasp the ends of a wax strip and slowly pull on the tabs to separate them. Then, lay the strips on your towel with the wax facing up. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Apply 1 of the strips onto the hair on your bikini area.
steps.content: Apply 1 of the strips onto the hair on your bikini area. Pick up the end of the wax strip and place the wax face down over the hair on your inner thigh. Make sure the strip is straight and then press it down onto your skin and hair. [19] X Research source Choose to start waxing in a different area, if you prefer. The inner thigh is typically less sensitive than your private areas, so it can help you get used to the feeling of waxing.

steps.title: Rub the strip 3-4 times in the direction of your hair growth.
steps.content: Rub the strip 3-4 times in the direction of your hair growth. Press the strip down onto your hair with your palm. Then, make 3 to 4 strokes over the strip in the direction of your hair growth. This helps the wax stick to your hair. [20] X Research source The strip should feel securely attached to your skin after you rub it.

steps.title: Hold your skin taut at the bottom of the wax strip.
steps.content: Hold your skin taut at the bottom of the wax strip. When your skin is loose, the strip might be difficult to remove or come off less evenly. Plus, it can make waxing feel more painful. Just use your non-dominant hand to pull the skin below the wax strip taut. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Pull off the wax strip in the opposite direction of your hair growth.
steps.content: Pull off the wax strip in the opposite direction of your hair growth. Use your dominant hand to grab the bottom end of the wax strip. Then, quickly pull on the strip in the opposite direction of your hair growth to remove your hair. [22] X Research source Rip off the strip in 1 quick, fluid motion to ensure all of your hair is removed. Use your hand to press down on the area you just waxed to help relieve any pain or discomfort. [23] X Research source It’s normal to feel some slight stinging when you rip off the strip. This is because the wax is removing your hair at the root, which is just below your skin. [24] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Continue applying wax strips until your entire bikini area is hair-free.
steps.content: Continue applying wax strips until your entire bikini area is hair-free. Apply a new strip to the area next to the spot you just waxed. Rip off that strip and then move to the next hairy spot. Simply work your way over your bikini area until all of the hair you want removed is gone. Just avoid waxing the same spot twice, as you can irritate or damage your skin. [25] X Research source Cut the strips into smaller shapes that better contour your body to wax hard-to-reach areas. If your wax strip is still sticky and not full of hair, reuse it 2 to 3 more times.

steps.title: Wipe off the excess wax using the cloth provided in the box.
steps.content: Wipe off the excess wax using the cloth provided in the box. Veet waxing products typically come with wet wipes to remove the excess wax from your skin. Just take a wipe and swipe it gently over your skin. Then, rinse your bikini area with warm water. [26] X Research source If you run out of wax removing cloths, use olive oil to remove any remaining wax. Soak a cotton swab in olive oil and then wipe the area that still has wax. Wear loose, cotton underwear and clothing after waxing to prevent any ingrown hairs from forming. [27] X Research source Apply a gentle, non-comedogenic moisturizer on your bikini area to help soothe your skin.
